filter.英释: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment

server.英释: one of the computers on a network that provides a special service

rustle.英释: if leaves, papers, clothes etc rustle, or if you rustle them, they make a noise as they rub against each other

esteem.英释: to respect and admire someone or something

exotic.英释: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

foster.英释: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

dilute.英释: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid

threat.英释: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

launch.英释: to make a new product, book etc available for sale for the first time

branch.英释: a local business, shop etc that is part of a larger business etc

fierce.英释: done with a lot of energy and strong feelings, and sometimes violence

extend.英释: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

column.英释: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

figure.英释: a number representing an amount, especially an official number

misled.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

resign.英释: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

prompt.英释: to make someone decide to do something

regime.英释: a particular system - used especially when talking about a previous system, or one that has just been introduced

hazard.英释: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

baffle.英释: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

strain.英释: worry that is caused by having to deal with a problem or work too hard over a long period of time

greedy.英释: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

robust.英释: a robust person is strong and healthy

turtle.英释: a  reptile  that lives mainly in water and has a soft body covered by a hard shell

render.英释: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

kidnap.英释: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them

resume.英释: a short written account of your education and your previous jobs that you send to an employer when you are looking for a new job

derive.英释: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something

impact.英释: the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

rhythm.英释: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

battle.英释: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

linger.英释: to stay somewhere a little longer, especially because you do not want to leave

handle.英释: the part of a door that you use for opening it

revive.英释: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

impair.英释: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

signal.英释: to be a sign that something is going to happen

resist.英释: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

burden.英释: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

hasten.英释: to make something happen faster or sooner

endure.英释: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

sector.英释: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

assume.英释: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

sample.英释: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

soothe.英释: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

entail.英释: to involve something as a necessary part or result

submit.英释: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

burial.英释: the act or ceremony of putting a dead body into a  grave

genius.英释: a very high level of intelligence, mental skill, or ability, which only a few people have

aspect.英释: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

decent.英释: of a good enough standard or quality

wonder.英释: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

inhale.英释: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

refine.英释: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

confer.英释: to officially give someone a title etc, especially as a reward for something they have achieved

spread.英释: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

bridge.英释: to build or form a bridge over something

perish.英释: to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way

recipe.英释: a set of instructions for cooking a particular type of food

divert.英释: to change the direction in which something travels

garage.英释: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house

hijack.英释: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship

format.英释: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged

evolve.英释: if an animal or plant evolves, it changes gradually over a long period of time

narrow.英释: to make something narrower or to become narrower

regain.英释: to get something back, especially an ability or quality, that you have lost

stress.英释: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

ascend.英释: to move up through the air

detect.英释: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

addict.中释: 吸毒上瘾者；对…着迷的人
addict.英释: someone who is unable to stop taking drugs

appeal.英释: an urgent request for something important

compel.英释: to force someone to do something

orient.英释: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

accrue.英释: if money accrues or is accrued, it gradually increases over a period of time

reckon.英释: spoken to think or suppose something

target.英释: to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

govern.英释: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

assert.英释: to state firmly that something is true

breezy.英释: a breezy person is happy, confident, and relaxed

derail.英释: if a train derails or something derails it, it goes off the tracks

excess.英释: a larger amount of something than is allowed or needed

recall.英释: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

plough.英释: a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted

needle.英释: a long thin piece of metal on a scientific instrument that moves backwards and forwards and points to numbers or directions

shrank.英释: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

shrink.英释: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water

fabric.英释: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

sexism.英释: the belief that one sex is weaker, less intelligent, or less important than the other, especially when this results in someone being treated unfairly

bruise.英释: if part of your body bruises, or if you bruise part of your body, it gets hit or hurt and a bruise appears

layout.英释: the way in which something such as a town, garden, or building is arranged

gender.英释: the fact of being male or female

subtle.英释: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

lounge.英释: a public room in a hotel or other building, that is used by many people as a place to relax

script.英释: the written form of a speech, play, film etc

thrive.英释: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

enrich.英释: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

clause.英释: a part of a written law or legal document covering a particular subject of the whole law or document

unfold.英释: if a story unfolds, or if someone unfolds it, it is told

fiscal.英释: relating to money, taxes, debts etc that are owned and managed by the government

apathy.英释: the feeling of not being interested in something, and not willing to make any effort to change or improve things

oblige.英释: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

debris.英释: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

desert.英释: to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them

embody.英释: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

backup.英释: extra help or support that you can get if necessary

poetry.英释: poems in general, or the art of writing them

tackle.英释: to try to deal with a difficult problem

steady.英释: continuing or developing gradually or without stopping, and not likely to change

agenda.英释: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

shrewd.英释: good at judging what people or situations are really like

ponder.英释: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

ethnic.英释: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

bitter.英释: making you feel very unhappy and upset

extent.英释: how large, important, or serious something is, especially something such as a problem or injury

remove.英释: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

modify.英释: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

mining.英释: the work or industry of getting gold, coal etc out of the earth

ritual.英释: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

impose.英释: to force someone to have the same ideas, beliefs etc as you

decode.英释: if a computer decodes data, it receives it and changes it into a form that can be used by the computer or understood by a person

reveal.英释: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

arouse.英释: to make you become interested, expect something etc

pursue.英释: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

layman.英释: someone who is not trained in a particular subject or type of work, especially when they are being compared with someone who is

switch.英释: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

victim.英释: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

flavor.英释: the particular taste of a food or drink

oppose.英释: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

domain.英释: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

urgent.英释: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

throne.英释: the position and power of being a king or queen

pierce.英释: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point

cancel.英释: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

strike.英释: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

manual.英释: manual work involves using your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind

emerge.英释: to appear or come out from somewhere

accuse.英释: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

impart.英释: to give information, knowledge, wisdom etc to someone

access.英释: to find information, especially on a computer

bemoan.英释: to complain or say that you are disappointed about something

resort.英释: a place where a lot of people go for holidays

engage.英释: If you engage in an activity, you do it or are actively involved with it

disarm.英释: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons

hinder.英释: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

ignore.英释: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

marine.英释: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

matter.英释: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

bother.英释: to annoy someone, especially by interrupting them when they are trying to do something

defect.英释: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect

ballet.英释: a performance in which dancing and music tell a story without any speaking

puzzle.英释: to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something

infant.英释: a baby or very young child

ruling.英释: an official decision, especially one made by a court

legend.英释: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

lessen.英释: to become smaller in size, importance, or value, or make something do this

margin.英释: the difference between what it costs a business to buy or produce something and what they sell it for

exceed.英释: to be more than a particular number or amount

action.英释: the process of doing something, especially in order to achieve a particular thing

makeup.英释: Makeup consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance

torque.英释: the force or power that makes something turn around a central point, especially in an engine

patent.英释: A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

clutch.英释: to hold something tightly because you do not want to lose it

inject.英释: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

bamboo.英释: a tall tropical plant with hollow stems that is used for making furniture

hearty.英释: happy and friendly and usually loud

proton.英释: a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical  charge  that is in the central part of an atom

rebuke.英释: to speak to someone severely about something they have done wrong

weaver.英释: someone whose job is to weave cloth

second.英释: to formally support a suggestion made by another person in a meeting

clinic.中释: 诊所，医务室；会诊；会诊时间；门诊时间
clinic.英释: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

summon.英释: to order someone to come to a place

cement.英释: to join two things together using cement , glue, etc.

hollow.英释: to make a hole or empty space by removing the inside part of something

ashore.英释: on or towards the shore of a lake, river, sea etc

preset.英释: to set the controls of a piece of electrical equipment so that it will start to work at a particular time

budget.英释: the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

cosmic.中释: 宇宙的；广大无边的，极大的
cosmic.英释: relating to space or the universe

cosmos.英释: the whole universe, especially when you think of it as a system

excuse.英释: to make your or sb else's behaviour seem less offensive by finding reasons for it

finite.英释: having an end or a limit

magnet.英释: something or someone that attracts many people or things

tanker.英释: a vehicle or ship specially built to carry large quantities of gas or liquid, especially oil

postal.英释: relating to the official system which takes letters from one place to another

cutter.英释: a tool that is used for cutting something

comply.英释: to do what you have to do or are asked to do

salute.英释: to move your right hand to your head, especially in order to show respect to an officer in the army, navy etc

ignite.英释: to start burning, or to make something start burning

banker.英释: someone who works in a bank in an important position

stitch.英释: to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

cradle.英释: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side

retard.英释: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected

pickle.英释: a thick cold sauce that is made from pieces of vegetables preserved in vinegar. It is usually eaten with cold meat or cheese

squash.英释: a drink made from fruit juice, sugar, and water

patrol.英释: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

cruise.英释: If you cruise an ocean, river, or canal, you travel around it or along it on a cruise

option.英释: a choice you can make in a particular situation

formal.英释: very correct and suitable for official or important occasions

closet.英释: a cupboard built into the wall of a room from the floor to the ceiling

linear.英释: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

gossip.英释: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

ramble.英释: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

comedy.英释: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

quench.英释: to stop a fire from burning

intake.英释: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

plague.英释: a disease that causes death and spreads quickly to a large number of people

crisis.英释: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

trifle.英释: to treat someone or something without respect or not in a serious way

devour.英释: to eat something quickly because you are very hungry

propel.英释: to move, drive, or push something forward

gather.英释: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

bandit.英释: someone who robs people, especially one of a group of people who attack travellers

misery.英释: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

thrash.英释: to beat someone violently, especially in order to punish them

notify.英释: to formally or officially tell someone about something

adjoin.英释: to be next to or joined to sth

accord.英释: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

purify.英释: to take a pure form of a substance out of another substance that contains it

outlaw.英释: someone who has done something illegal, and who is hiding in order to avoid punishment – used especially about criminals in the past

detail.英释: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something

deform.英释: to change or spoil the usual or natural shape of sth

fringe.英释: a decorative edge of hanging threads on a curtain, piece of clothing etc

random.英释: happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

garlic.英释: a plant like a small onion, used in cooking to give a strong taste

preach.英释: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

watery.中释: 充满水的；与水有关的；湿的；（食物、饮料等）味淡的
watery.英释: full of water or relating to water

pledge.英释: to make someone formally promise something

indoor.英释: used or happening inside a building

soften.英释: to become or to make sb/sth more sympathetic and less severe or critical

subdue.英释: to bring sb/sth under control, especially by using force

mingle.英释: to combine or make one thing combine with another

mature.英释: to become fully grown or developed

tangle.英释: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

vector.英释: a quantity such as force that has a direction as well as size

pantry.英释: a very small room in a house where food is kept

quartz.英释: a hard mineral substance that is used in making electronic watches and clocks

kidney.英释: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine

censor.英释: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

shrine.英释: a place that is connected with a holy event or holy person, and that people visit to pray

divine.英释: coming from or relating to God or a god

trench.英释: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground

reject.英释: to throw away something that has just been made, because its quality is not good enough

maiden.英释: a young girl, or a woman who is not married

scorch.英释: to burn and slightly damage a surface by making it too hot; to be slightly burned by heat

trader.英释: someone who buys and sells goods or stocks

dealer.英释: someone who buys and sells a particular product, especially an expensive one

gravel.英释: small stones, used to make a surface for paths, roads etc

uproar.英释: a lot of noise or angry protest about something

choice.英释: (especially of food) of very good quality

tropic.英释: one of the two imaginary lines around the world, either the Tropic of Cancer which is 23.5˚ north of the  equator  , or the Tropic of Capricorn which is 23.5˚ south of the equator

induce.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

global.英释: affecting or including the whole world

mosque.英释: a building in which Muslims worship

bronze.英释: the dark reddish brown colour of bronze

mighty.英释: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive

knight.英释: a man with a high rank in the past who was trained to fight while riding a horse

marvel.英释: to be very surprised or impressed by sth

bushel.英释: a unit for measuring grain and fruit (equal in volume to 8 gallons)

barren.英释: (of land or soil) not good enough for plants to grow on it

bleach.英释: to make something pale or white, especially by using chemicals or the sun

bypass.英释: to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it

strive.英释: to make a great effort to achieve something

Saturn.英释: the planet that is sixth in order from the sun and is surrounded by large rings

wrench.英释: a twisting movement that pulls something violently

nickel.英释: a hard silver-white metal that is often combined with other metals, for example to make steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Ni

junior.英释: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are

tickle.英释: to move your fingers on a sensitive part of sb's body in a way that makes them laugh

sodium.英释: a common silver-white metal that usually exists in combination with other substances, for example in salt. It is a chemical element: symbol Na

oyster.英释: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl

module.英释: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job

expire.英释: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

circus.英释: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

spiral.英释: moving in a continuous curve that winds around a central point

thesis.英释: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

willow.英释: a type of tree that has long thin branches and grows near water, or the wood from this tree

consul.英释: a government official sent to live in a foreign city to help people from his or her own country who are living or staying there

retail.英释: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else

martyr.英释: someone who dies for their religious or political beliefs and is admired by people for this

expect.英释: to think that you will find that someone or something has a particular quality or does a particular thing

ripple.英释: a small low wave on the surface of a liquid

mitten.英释: a type of glove that does not have separate parts for each finger

stereo.英释: using a recording or broadcasting system in which the sound is directed through two speakers

shabby.英释: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

flight.英释: when you leave a place in order to try and escape from a person or a dangerous situation

parade.英释: if you parade your skills, knowledge, possessions etc, you show them publicly in order to make people admire you

wither.英释: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die

aerial.英释: in or moving through the air

unlock.英释: to unfasten the lock on a door, box etc

uphold.英释: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

reside.英释: to live in a particular place

Christ.英释: the man who is worshipped by Christians as the son of God

finely.英释: in a very careful, delicate, or exact way

dismay.英释: the worry, disappointment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens

ginger.英释: the root of the ginger plant used in cooking as a spice

splash.英释: the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

theory.英释: an opinion or idea that sb believes is true but that is not proved

sturdy.英释: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

shrill.英释: to produce a very high and unpleasant sound

beetle.英释: an insect with a round hard back that is usually black

heater.英释: a machine for making air or water hotter

deepen.英释: if colour or light deepens or if sth deepens it, it becomes darker

scheme.英释: to secretly make clever and dishonest plans to get or achieve something

bazaar.英释: a market or area where there are a lot of small shops, especially in India or the Middle East

guitar.英释: a musical instrument that usually has six strings, that you play with your fingers or with a plectrum

timely.英释: done or happening at exactly the right time

severe.英释: very difficult and needing a lot of effort and skill

piston.英释: a part of an engine consisting of a short solid piece of metal inside a tube, which moves up and down to make the other parts of the engine move

vigour.英释: physical or mental energy and determination

locust.英释: an insect that lives mainly in Asia and Africa and flies in a very large group, eating and destroying crops

fossil.英释: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

glider.英释: a light plane that flies without an engine

pulley.英释: a piece of equipment consisting of a wheel over which a rope or chain is pulled to lift heavy things

walnut.英释: a nut that you can eat, shaped like a human brain

strait.英释: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas

custom.英释: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

pirate.英释: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them

inland.英释: located in or near the middle of a country, not near the edge or on the coast

boiler.英释: a container for boiling water that is part of a steam engine, or is used to provide heating in a house

roller.英释: a piece of equipment consisting of a tube-shaped piece of wood, metal etc that rolls over and over, used for painting, crushing, making things smoother etc

salmon.英释: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs

define.英释: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

radial.英释: arranged in a circular shape with bars or lines coming from the centre

coffin.英释: a long box in which a dead person is buried or burnt

client.英释: someone who gets services or advice from a professional person, company, or organization

cereal.英释: a plant grown to produce grain, for example wheat, rice etc

gutter.英释: the low part at the edge of a road where water collects and flows away

number.英释: to make a particular number when added together

studio.英释: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded

answer.英释: to be suitable for sth; to match sth

denial.英释: a statement saying that something is not true

offset.英释: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

detach.英释: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

litter.英释: to leave waste paper, cans etc on the ground in a public place

estate.英释: all of someone’s property and money, especially everything that is left after they die

hamper.英释: to make it difficult for someone to do something

mirror.英释: something that gives a clear idea of what something else is like

decree.英释: an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country

outlet.英释: a way of expressing or getting rid of strong feelings

dynamo.英释: a machine that changes some other form of power directly into electricity

rattle.英释: to make a series of short loud sounds when hitting against sth hard; to make sth do this

malice.英释: the desire to harm someone because you hate them

resent.英释: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

affirm.英释: to state publicly that something is true

cuckoo.英释: a grey European bird that puts its eggs in other birds’  nests and that makes a sound that sounds like its name

gamble.英释: to risk losing sth in the hope of being successful

cavity.英释: a hole or space inside something

grease.英释: a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil

kindle.英释: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

murmur.英释: a continuous low sound, like the noise of a river or of voices far away.

enroll.英释: to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this

burner.英释: one of the round parts on the top of a cooker that produce heat

detain.英释: to officially prevent someone from leaving a place

simple.英释: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

stride.英释: a long step you make while you are walking

barley.英释: a plant that produces a grain used for making food or alcohol

widely.英释: to a large degree – used when talking about differences

sneeze.英释: to have air come suddenly and noisily out through your nose and mouth in a way that you cannot control, for example because you have a cold

thresh.英释: to separate grains of corn, wheat etc from the rest of the plant by beating it with a special tool or machine

latent.英释: existing, but not yet very noticeable, active or well developed

vulgar.英释: not having or showing good taste; not polite, elegant or well behaved

jungle.英释: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

author.英释: the person who starts a plan or idea

report.英释: information that something has happened, which may or may not be true

herald.英释: someone who carried messages from a ruler in the past

sensor.英释: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

convey.英释: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

strife.英释: trouble between two or more people or groups

length.英释: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

repeal.英释: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law

waggon.英释: a large open container pulled by a train, used for carrying goods

shovel.英释: to lift and move earth, stones etc with a shovel

errand.英释: a short journey in order to do something for someone, for example delivering or collecting something for them

groove.英释: a thin line cut into a hard surface

napkin.英释: a square piece of cloth or paper used for protecting your clothes and for cleaning your hands and lips during a meal

sermon.英释: a talk given as part of a Christian church service, usually on a religious or moral subject

absent.英释: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go

stuffy.英释: (of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air

opaque.英释: (of glass, liquid, etc.) not clear enough to see through or allow light through

mammal.英释: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

reason.英释: to form a particular judgment about a situation after carefully considering the facts

loosen.英释: to make something less tight or less firmly fastened, or to become less tight or less firmly fastened

hearth.英释: the area of floor around a fireplace in a house

patron.英释: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money

sullen.英释: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you

arctic.英释: the regions of the world around the North Pole

tragic.英释: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

tyrant.英释: a ruler who has complete power and uses it in a cruel and unfair way

radius.英释: an area that covers a particular distance in all directions from a central point

bestow.英释: to give someone something of great value or importance

should.英释: used to say what is the right or sensible thing to do

market.英释: to try to persuade people to buy a product by advertising it in a particular way, using attractive packages etc

lining.英释: a piece of material that covers the inside of something, especially a piece of clothing

climax.英释: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

shrimp.英释: a small sea creature that you can eat, which has ten legs and a soft shell

elapse.英释: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

hoarse.英释: if you are hoarse, or if your voice is hoarse, you speak in a low rough voice, for example because your throat is sore

quiver.英释: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc

ticket.英释: a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car

bishop.英释: a priest with a high rank in some Christian religions, who is the head of all the churches and priests in a large area

insert.英释: to put something inside or into something else

kernel.英释: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

wisdom.英释: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

versus.英释: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

pedlar.英释: someone who, in the past, walked from place to place selling small things

escort.英释: a person or a group of people or vehicles that go with someone in order to protect or guard them

jingle.英释: to shake small metal things together so that they make a sound, or to make this sound

thrill.英释: to make someone feel excited and happy

rotate.英释: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this

retort.英释: to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

chorus.英释: to sing or say sth all together

beware.英释: used to warn someone to be careful because something is dangerous

dazzle.英释: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

credit.英释: the belief that something is true or correct
